conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph and understand the scenario involving two cars that collide due to braking at the same time.
Car A is traveling at 25 m/s, and Car B is traveling at 15 m/s. Both cars start braking simultaneously.
Determine the braking distance for each car. Both cars brake at the same time, the distance they travel before coming to a stop is the same.
Car A travels 20 seconds to stop, and Car B travels 25 seconds to stop.
Calculate the initial distance between the two cars based on the difference in their initial speeds.
Car A travels 20 seconds at 25 m/s, so the initial distance is 500 meters.
Since the cars collide, the initial distance between them is the sum of the distances each car traveled before the collision.
The total initial distance is 500 meters (Car A) + 500 meters (Car B) = 1000 meters.
The final distance between the two cars after the collision is the initial distance minus the distance traveled by each car during the collision.
Calculate the final distance between the two cars after the collision. The total initial distance is 1000 meters, so the final distance is 500 meters.
